intro: Swainsona flavicarinata, commonly known as the yellow mallow, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Australia. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in sandy or rocky soils. The plant produces showy yellow flowers with distinctive red or orange markings near the base of the petals. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often covered in fine hairs. Swainsona flavicarinata is adapted to drought conditions and is often found in coastal and inland areas.
